title: How To Make Any Champion Broken (Rito Game Balance New Employee Training)
body:
1. Nerf items that could potentially defend against that champion ({{item:3075}} {{item:3110}} {{item:3143}})
2. Introduce new items and buff existing items specifically for making champion stronger  ({{item:3053}} {{item:3748}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3742}} )
3. Add a bunch of true damage / defense-ignoring abilities to the champions' kit ({{champion:41}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:86}}) because ccounterplay is no fun.
4. Jack up all of champion's base stats so their playstyle literally becomes "ball-of-stats" that can do well no matter how much gold they have ({{champion:122}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:86}})
5. Don't play test the champion at all and accept no feedback from anyone who tries. 
6. Wonder why champion sits at 55-60% (or higher) win rate.
7. Scratch your head as to why champion is perma pick/banned including at major international tournaments. 
8. Wait 5 patches (minimum) before fixing champion and repeating steps 1-8 on a new champion (the one with the new skin coming out).

One of the highest base AD **and** tied with Darius for #1 AD per level with his Q doing a total of 390% AD as magic damage. Riiiiggggghhhttt

Except for the fact that he's slower than Darius (325 compared to 340) and all of his other stats (except for MR [both have 32.1 at lvl 1) and melee range (200 to Darius' 175) are worse.  He also lacks the pull and double slow that Darius has, making it much harder for him to stick to a target to actually use that base AD.

Also, that 390% AD scaling?  That requires a level 5 Q.  Both the multiplier and the AD scaling are dependent on level, meaning that he won't have that kind of scaling until level 9 at the earliest.  And no, you don't always max Q first on Morde.

Except for the fact that Morde gets to build ADC while dishing out massive AP nukes from his Q that scale off his AD making it impossible to counter build him efficiently. Add this to the fact that Darius doesnt get a **giant f$%king dragon** to fight for him. Add this to the fact that Morde can play with a support while still getting solo lane XP

Counter building Morde is not difficult at all.

1.  Build MR.
2.  Done.

The fact is that Morde most likely isn't going to build straight AD - doing so makes him fall off hard after level 9 or so, since only Q and E scale off of AD, he's not good as an autoattacker, and his ult (in other words, the thing that he depends on in teamfights) will do very little damage.  In addition, both Trinity Force (which is hybrid) and Rylai's (which is absolutely core on new Morde) don't give much or any AD, and Morde also needs to build tank items to prevent himself from getting blown up.  Even with AD scalings, Morde's primarily going to do magic damage, so building MR (I recommend Hexdrinker or Spirit Visage over Banshee's - it's too easy for Morde to pop the bubble with E) significantly reduces his damage.

People also seem to really overestimate the dragon's strength.  It's strong in the early game, yes, but that's also when Morde gets it for the least amount of time.  The dragon does deal a lot of damage (it's damage is based off %max hp) but it's AI is incredibly bad, and it's very easy to lose control of it.  It also goes down quite quickly to any degree of focus.  If Morde can get his team to group as 5, it's very powerful, but otherwise, it's only moderately powerful.

The W passive is absolutely a problem, but that's a larger issue than Morde's base stats, and one that Morde mains generally want to see nerfed or outright gone.

> The fact is that Morde most likely isn't going to build straight AD - doing so makes him fall off hard after level 9 or so, since only Q and E scale off of AD, he's not good as an autoattacker

Whew! Good thing his Q and E don't scale off both AD **and** AP. 

Oh crap they do...

But both deal magic damage, so MR will significantly reduce their damage.  Just because it scales off of AD doesn't mean it deals hybrid damage.  That's why AD Morde falls off after 9 - once his Q is maxed, his damage output is about as good as it is going to get.  Yes, E scales off of AD, but its damage was significantly reduced, and it doesn't have the impact it used to have.  Again, Morde isn't going to be doing a ton of autoattacking - most of his damage comes from his abilities, and he doesn't build a ton of attack speed to use those autos.  Morde, for instance, will never build PD/Shiv.
Yeah even with an ad build, morde still does about 70% magic damage.  So MR is still very effective and he has no true damge at least.
